resources.string: All the information displayed in this application is purely informative and further professional medical attention should be sought after the prescribed application of first aid.
THIS APP IS PUBLISHED BY KABRICKS INC. UNDER ITS CSR BRANCH AND IS FREE FOR DISTRIBUTION IN ALL FORMS
This information will only be used to display information to rescuers in case of an emergency and will not be used in any harmfull way
Adding an ICE(\"In Case of Emergency\") contact to your phone can help emergency personnel to locate a friend or family member who can speak on your behalf if you become unconscious or incapacitated

The Kabricks Inc. has endeavoured to ensure that this app reflects the relevant guidance from informed authoritative sources, current at the time of launch. While the material contained here provides only initial care and treatment, it must not be regarded as a substitute for medical advice.

We are often asked if someone could be sued for performing first aid incorrectly. Our role is not to advise on legal issues. However, where someone is acting in good faith to help save someone\'s life or prevent further injury, there is little risk of them being successfully sued for doing that.

At the Kabricks we are committed to protecting your privacy. This statement is made in light of the requirements of the Data Protection Act in order to alert you to our data precessing of your data. if you have any queries about this statement, please contact us.

We will use your information to provide you with the information, products or services you have requested, for administration purposes, to further our charitable aims and to comply with the law. We may need to share your information with our trading subsdiaries, service providers , associated organisations and agents for these purposes
We will not share your information with other like minded organisation for the purpose of marketing unless you have previously indicated that you are happy for us to do so.
We take appropriate measures to ensure that the information disclosed to us is kept secure, accurate and up to date and kept only as long as necessary for the purpose for which it s used.
By providing us with your personal data, you consent to the collection and use of such information you provide in accordance with the above purposes and this privacy statement
You have the right to ask for a copy of the information we hold about you, for which we may charge a small fee and to have any inaccurancies in your information corrected

If your personal details change, please hep us to keep your information up to date by notifying us. we reserve the right to amend the privacy statement at any time. if we do, we will post notice of the change on our website and this mobile app and you will be deemed to have accepted such changes

Use anything available to you - it doesn\'t need to be dressing pads from a first aid kit. You can use your hand, their hand, a t-shirt, a towel - anything rhat can be put over the wound to stop or slow down the flow of blood

For minor cuts and grazes, you can wash the wound to remove any dirt. Don\'t wash a wound that is bleeding heavily. If you put a heavily bleeding wound, you will wash away all the clotting agents and make it bleed more.
Do not remove it - it\'s helping plug the hole and stop the blood flow. instead, simply apply pressure around the object. Removing the object from the wound can make the bleeding much worse
